slidetranscripts.slidetranscript:
<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Our Natomas Distribution Center receives and warehouses perishable foods for all departments, as well as liquor, general merchandise and other center store products. And because the DC ships these products to all of our stores, it’s crucial that effective food safety practices are in place to ensure these products remain safe and wholesome. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="For this Distribution Center Module, we’ll take a look at several unique food safety challenges and the best practices that must be in place to control them. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Let’s start with Time/Temperature management. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Although the Distribution Center has a sophisticated and reliable refrigeration system, there is still ample opportunity for temperature abuse. Employ these best practices to effectively manage time and temperature: 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="13" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="Bullet" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="In refrigerated areas, keep all exterior dock and manual doors tightly closed when not in use. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="13" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="Bullet" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="There are different temperature zones within the building – ensure foods are stored and staged in the zone appropriate for the product. As an example, PHF/TCS foods must be stored or staged at or below 41F, while many other products can be stored or staged at 55F. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="13" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="Bullet" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Trailers used to transport PHF/TCS foods must be pre-chilled to 41F or below before being loaded. And, once fully loaded, trailer doors should be tightly closed for effective temperature control. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="As you can imagine, with a huge facility full of food, it’s critical that the facility be maintained clean at all times – inside and out – if we are to ensure these foods remain safe while onsite. Follow these best practices for success: 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="13" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="Bullet" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Keep the facility free from accumulation of debris, spills and standing water – more on that later when we discuss pest control. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="13" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="Bullet" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="If you are assigned to facility cleaning tasks, ensure Sanitation Standard Operating Procedures – also known as SSOPs - are closely followed, and the activity is documented on the appropriate cleaning checklist. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="13" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="Bullet" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="A special note about raw animal protein spills: Ensure these spills are promptly cleaned and sanitized. Failing to do so promotes the potential spread of harmful bacteria throughout the facility by pallet jacks and forklifts as they travel from aisle to aisle. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="13" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="Bullet" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Empty garbage receptacles throughout the day " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Store all food and supplies away from walls to facilitate inspection and cleaning, and at least six inches off the floor or on a standard size pallet. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Store lunches and other personal belongings in provided lockers. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Chemicals must be properly segregated away from foods and food contact surfaces, and maintained in a secure storage area when not in use. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Effective pest control is crucial in ensuring products stored in the DC are safe and wholesome, and that products later delivered to our stores are free from pests or other evidence of pest activity. Let’s review best practices for limiting pest activity at this facility: 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Number ONE: Work closely with our pest control provider by promptly reporting to DC leadership any pest sighting or other evidence of pest activity such as rodent droppings, nesting material or damaged product. Ensure that such observations are documented in the pest control binder. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Never apply pest control chemicals – all chemicals must be applied by our pest control provider. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Ensure interior traps are properly placed against walls, and in good condition. Promptly report to DC leadership any device in need of repair or replacement. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Exterior rodent bait stations must be secured against the building exterior, and care must be taken to ensure they are not damaged by equipment that might be operating in the area. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="All openings to the exterior of the facility must be closed when not in use and tightly sealed. There should be no daylight visible around these openings. Report such observations to DC leadership for prompt repair, as needed. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="As mentioned earlier, keep the facility, both indoors and outdoors, clean and free of debris buildup, food spills and standing water. Poor housekeeping provides food, water and shelter for pests. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Do not store anything in yard trailers unless doors are fully intact and tightly closed. Otherwise, rodents can get inside the trailer and then into the building when the trailer is later backed into a dock. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Keep the Bale Dock clean and free of clutter at all times. Because the Bale Dock is open to the exterior of the property, rodents can easily enter this part of the building, so we want to limit places they can hide. It’s also important to keep doors between the Bale Dock and the rest of the facility closed at all times when not in use, to discourage rodent travel from the dock to areas of the facility where foods are stored. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>
